sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
message_1: Let A = {1, 4, 7} and B = {2, 5, 8}. Find (A × B) △ B and (B × A) △ B, where × is the Cartesian product and △ is the symmetric difference. Show that the two results are not equal and hence prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to symmetric difference.
